form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT, Form I -263B ( (Rev. 4-1-68)

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE RECORD OF SWORN STATEMENT Office: Los Angeles, California File No.: A17 181 791 Statement by: Mao, Pei-Eng In the case of: Mao, Pei-Eng At: 300 North Los Angeles Street Date: April 18, 1969 Before: Philip H. Smith, Investigator (Name and Title) In the Chinese language. Interpreter Mr.H. H. Hee used. Also present: Respondent's employer, Mrs. Jean Fogg. I am an officer of the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, author- ized by law to administer oaths and take testimony in connection with the enforcement of the Immigration and Nationality laws of the United States. I desire to take your sworn statement regarding your status in the United States under the United States immigration laws, and where you have worked in the United States. Before we ask you any questions, you must understand your rights. You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can be used against you in court, or in any immigration or administrative proceeding. You have the right to talk to a lawyer for advice before we ask you any questions and to have him with you during questioning. If you cannot afford a lawyer, one will be appointed for you before any questioning if you wish. If you decide to answer questions now without a lawyer present, you will still have the right to stop answering at any time. You also have the right to stop answering at any time until you talk to a lawyer. Q. Do you wish to have a lawyer or any other person present to advise you? A. No, I don't. Q. Are you willing to answer my questions at this time? A. Yes. Q. Please stand and raise your right hand. (Respondent complies) Q. Do you swear that all the statements you are about to make will be the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God? A. Yes, I do. Form I -263B (Rev. 4-1-68)
